refs.noise\/.zattrs: {"description":"Measured noise power for each receive echo of the plus_y and minus_y SLC channels"}
refs.noise\/noise_minus_y\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["noise\/num_lines"],"comment":"Noise power for the minus_y channel expressed in linear units (arbitrary units that give noise-equivalent sigma0 when normalized by the X factor).","long_name":"Noise estimate for the minus_y channel","units":"1","valid_max":1.0000000200408773e+20,"valid_min":0.0}
refs.noise\/noise_plus_y\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["noise\/num_lines"],"comment":"Noise power for the plus_y channel expressed in linear units (arbitrary units that give noise-equivalent sigma0 when normalized by the X factor).","long_name":"Noise estimate for the plus_y channel","units":"1","valid_max":1.0000000200408773e+20,"valid_min":0.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/ancillary_surface_classific: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"7-state surface type classification computed from a mask built with MODIS and GlobCover data.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","flag_meanings":"open_ocean land continental_water aquatic_vegetation continental_ice_snow floating_ice salted_basin","flag_values":[0,1,2,3,4,5,6],"institution":"European Space Agency","long_name":"surface classification","source":"MODIS\/GlobCover","standard_name":"status_flag","valid_max":6,"valid_min":0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/azimuth_index\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Rare interferogram azimuth index (indexed from 0).","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"rare interferogram azimuth index","units":"1","valid_max":999999,"valid_min":0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/bright_land_flag\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Flag indicating areas that are not typically water but are expected to be bright (e.g., urban areas, ice). Flag value 2 indicates cases where prior data indicate land, but where prior_water_prob indicates possible water.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","flag_meanings":"not_bright_land bright_land bright_land_or_water","flag_values":[0,1,2],"long_name":"bright land flag","standard_name":"status_flag","valid_max":2,"valid_min":0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/classification\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Flags indicating water detection results.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","flag_meanings":"land land_near_water water_near_land open_water land_near_dark_water dark_water_edge dark_water","flag_values":[1,2,3,4,22,23,24],"long_name":"classification","valid_max":24,"valid_min":1}
refs.pixel_cloud\/coherent_power\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Power computed by combining the plus_y and minus_y channels coherently by co-aligning the phases (arbitrary units that give sigma0 when noise subtracted and normalized by the X factor).","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"coherent power combination of minus_y and plus_y channels","units":"1","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":0.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/cross_track\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Approximate cross-track location of the pixel.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"approximate cross-track location","units":"m","valid_max":75000.0,"valid_min":-75000.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/darea_dheight\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Sensitivity of the pixel area to the reference height.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"sensitivity of pixel area to reference height","units":"m^2\/m","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":-999999.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/dheight_dbaseline\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Sensitivity of the height estimate to the interferometric baseline.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"sensitivity of height estimate to interferometric baseline","units":"m\/m","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":-999999.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/dheight_dphase\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Sensitivity of the height estimate to the interferogram phase.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"sensitivity of height estimate to interferogram phase","units":"m\/radian","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":-999999.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/dheight_drange\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Sensitivity of the height estimate to the range (delay).","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"sensitivity of height estimate to range (delay)","units":"m\/m","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":-999999.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/dheight_droll\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Sensitivity of the height estimate to the spacecraft roll.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"sensitivity of height estimate to spacecraft roll","units":"m\/degrees","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":-999999.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/dlatitude_dphase\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Sensitivity of the latitude estimate to the interferogram phase.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"sensitivity of latitude estimate to interferogram phase","units":"degrees\/radian","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":-999999.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/dlongitude_dphase\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Sensitivity of the longitude estimate to the interferogram phase.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"sensitivity of longitude estimate to interferogram phase","units":"degrees\/radian","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":-999999.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/eff_num_medium_looks\/.zatt: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Effective number of independent looks taken in forming the medium interferogram (after adaptive averaging).","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"effective number of medium looks","units":"1","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":0.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/eff_num_rare_looks\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Effective number of independent looks taken to form the rare interferogram.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"effective number of rare looks","units":"1","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":0.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/false_detection_rate\/.zatt: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Probability of falsely detecting water when there is none.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"false detection rate","units":"1","valid_max":1.0,"valid_min":0.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/geoid\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Geoid height above the reference ellipsoid with a correction to refer the value to the mean tide system, i.e. includes the permanent tide (zero frequency).","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"geoid height","source":"EGM2008 (Pavlis et al., 2012)","standard_name":"geoid_height_above_reference_ellipsoid","units":"m","valid_max":150.0,"valid_min":-150.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/height\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Height of the pixel above the reference ellipsoid.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"height above reference ellipsoid","units":"m","valid_max":15000.0,"valid_min":-1500.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/height_cor_xover\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Height correction from KaRIn crossover calibration. The correction is applied before geolocation but reported as an equivalent height correction.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"height correction from KaRIn crossovers","units":"m","valid_max":10.0,"valid_min":-10.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/illumination_time\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"calendar":"gregorian","comment":"Time of measurement in seconds in the UTC time scale since 1 Jan 2000 00:00:00 UTC. [tai_utc_difference] is the difference between TAI and UTC reference time (seconds) for the first measurement of the data set. If a leap second occurs within the data set, the attribute leap_second is set to the UTC time at which the leap second occurs.","leap_second":"YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss","long_name":"time of illumination of each pixel (UTC)","standard_name":"time","tai_utc_difference":"[Value of TAI-UTC at time of first record]","units":"seconds since 2000-01-01 00:00:00.000"}
refs.pixel_cloud\/illumination_time_tai\/.zat: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"calendar":"gregorian","comment":"Time of measurement in seconds in the TAI time scale since 1 Jan 2000 00:00:00 TAI. This time scale contains no leap seconds. The difference (in seconds) with time in UTC is given by the attribute [illumination_time:tai_utc_difference].","long_name":"time of illumination of each pixel (TAI)","standard_name":"time","units":"seconds since 2000-01-01 00:00:00.000"}
refs.pixel_cloud\/instrument_attitude_cor\/.z: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Term that incorporates all calibration corrections applied to attitude before geolocation.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"instrument attitude correction","units":"degrees","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":-999999.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/instrument_baseline_cor\/.z: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Term that incorporates all calibration corrections applied to baseline before geolocation.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"instrument baseline correction","units":"m","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":-999999.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/instrument_phase_cor\/.zatt: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Term that incorporates all calibration corrections applied to phase before geolocation.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"instrument phase correction","units":"radians","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":-999999.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/instrument_range_cor\/.zatt: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Term that incorporates all calibration corrections applied to range before geolocation.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"instrument range correction","units":"m","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":-999999.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/iono_cor_gim_ka\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Equivalent vertical correction due to ionosphere delay. The reported pixel height, latitude and longitude are computed after adding negative media corrections to uncorrected range along slant-range paths, accounting for the differential delay between the two KaRIn antennas. The equivalent vertical correction is computed by applying obliquity factors to the slant-path correction. Adding the reported correction to the reported pixel height results in the uncorrected pixel height.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","institution":"JPL","long_name":"ionosphere vertical correction","source":"Global Ionosphere Maps","units":"m","valid_max":0.0,"valid_min":-0.5}
refs.pixel_cloud\/latitude\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Geodetic latitude [-80,80] (degrees north of equator) of the pixel.","long_name":"latitude (positive N, negative S)","standard_name":"latitude","units":"degrees_north","valid_max":80.0,"valid_min":-80.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/layover_impact\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Estimate of the height error caused by layover, which may not be reliable on a pixel by pixel basis, but may be useful to augment aggregated height uncertainties.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"layover impact","units":"m","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":-999999.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/load_tide_fes\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Geocentric load tide height. The effect of the ocean tide loading of the Earth's crust. This value is reported for reference but is not applied to the reported height.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","institution":"LEGOS\/CNES","long_name":"geocentric load tide height (FES)","source":"FES2014b (Carrere et al., 2016)","units":"m","valid_max":0.20000000298023224,"valid_min":-0.20000000298023224}
refs.pixel_cloud\/load_tide_got\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Geocentric load tide height. The effect of the ocean tide loading of the Earth's crust. This value is reported for reference but is not applied to the reported height.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","institution":"GSFC","long_name":"geocentric load tide height (GOT)","source":"GOT4.10c (Ray, 2013)","units":"m","valid_max":0.20000000298023224,"valid_min":-0.20000000298023224}
refs.pixel_cloud\/longitude\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Longitude [-180,180) (east of the Greenwich meridian) of the pixel.","long_name":"longitude (degrees East)","standard_name":"longitude","units":"degrees_east","valid_max":180.0,"valid_min":-180.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/missed_detection_rate\/.zat: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Probability of falsely detecting no water when there is water.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"missed detection rate","units":"1","valid_max":1.0,"valid_min":0.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/model_dry_tropo_cor\/.zattr: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Equivalent vertical correction due to dry troposphere delay. The reported pixel height, latitude and longitude are computed after adding negative media corrections to uncorrected range along slant-range paths, accounting for the differential delay between the two KaRIn antennas. The equivalent vertical correction is computed by applying obliquity factors to the slant-path correction. Adding the reported correction to the reported pixel height results in the uncorrected pixel height.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","institution":"ECMWF","long_name":"dry troposphere vertical correction","source":"European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts","units":"m","valid_max":-1.5,"valid_min":-3.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/model_wet_tropo_cor\/.zattr: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Equivalent vertical correction due to wet troposphere delay. The reported pixel height, latitude and longitude are computed after adding negative media corrections to uncorrected range along slant-range paths, accounting for the differential delay between the two KaRIn antennas. The equivalent vertical correction is computed by applying obliquity factors to the slant-path correction. Adding the reported correction to the reported pixel height results in the uncorrected pixel height.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","institution":"ECMWF","long_name":"wet troposphere vertical correction","source":"European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts","units":"m","valid_max":0.0,"valid_min":-1.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/phase_noise_std\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Estimate of the phase noise standard deviation.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"phase noise standard deviation","units":"radians","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":-999999.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/phase_unwrapping_region\/.z: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Phase unwrapping region index.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"phase unwrapping region index","units":"1","valid_max":99999999,"valid_min":-1}
refs.pixel_cloud\/pixc_qual\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Quality flag for pixel cloud data","coordinates":"longitude latitude","flag_meanings":"good bad","flag_values":[0,1],"standard_name":"status_flag","valid_max":1,"valid_min":0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/pole_tide\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Geocentric pole tide height. The total of the contribution from the solid-Earth (body) pole tide height and the load pole tide height (i.e., the effect of the ocean pole tide loading of the Earth's crust).","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"geocentric pole tide height","source":"Wahr (1985) and Desai et al. (2015)","units":"m","valid_max":0.20000000298023224,"valid_min":-0.20000000298023224}
refs.pixel_cloud\/power_minus_y\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Power for the minus_y channel (arbitrary units that give sigma0 when noise subtracted and normalized by the X factor).","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"power for minus_y channel","units":"1","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":0.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/power_plus_y\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Power for the plus_y channel (arbitrary units that give sigma0 when noise subtracted and normalized by the X factor).","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"power for plus_y channel","units":"1","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":0.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/prior_water_prob\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Prior probability of water occurring.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"prior water probability","units":"1","valid_max":1.0,"valid_min":0.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/range_index\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Rare interferogram range index (indexed from 0).","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"rare interferogram range index","units":"1","valid_max":999999,"valid_min":0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/sig0\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Normalized radar cross section (sigma0) in real, linear units (not decibels). refs.pixel_cloud\/solid_earth_tide\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Solid-Earth (body) tide height. The zero-frequency permanent tide component is not included.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"solid Earth tide height","source":"Cartwright and Taylor (1971) and Cartwright and Edden (1973)","units":"m","valid_max":1.0,"valid_min":-1.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/water_frac\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Noisy estimate of the fraction of the pixel that is water.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"water fraction","units":"1","valid_max":10000.0,"valid_min":-1000.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/water_frac_uncert\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"Uncertainty estimate of the water fraction estimate (width of noisy water frac estimate distribution).","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"water fraction uncertainty","units":"1","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":0.0}
refs.pixel_cloud\/x_factor_minus_y\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["pixel_cloud\/points"],"comment":"X factor for the minus_y channel power in linear units (arbitrary units to normalize noise-subtracted power to sigma0).","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"X factor for minus_y channel power","units":"1","valid_max":999999.0,"valid_min":0.0}

refs.tvp\/.zattrs: {"description":"Time varying parameters group including spacecraft attitude, position, velocity, and antenna position information"}

refs.tvp\/latitude\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["tvp\/num_tvps"],"comment":"Geodetic latitude of the KMSF origin with respect to the reference ellipsoid.","long_name":"latitude (positive N, negative S) of the spacecraft","standard_name":"latitude","units":"degrees_north","valid_max":80.0,"valid_min":-80.0}
refs.tvp\/longitude\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["tvp\/num_tvps"],"comment":"Longitude of the KMSF origin, with positive values indicating longitudes east of the Greenwich meridian.","long_name":"longitude (degrees East) of the spacecraft","standard_name":"longitude","units":"degrees_east","valid_max":180.0,"valid_min":-180.0}
refs.tvp\/minus_y_antenna_x\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["tvp\/num_tvps"],"comment":"x coordinate of the minus_y antenna phase center in the ECEF frame.","long_name":"x coordinate of the minus_y antenna phase center in the ECEF frame","units":"m","valid_max":10000000.0,"valid_min":-10000000.0}
refs.tvp\/minus_y_antenna_y\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["tvp\/num_tvps"],"comment":"y coordinate of the minus_y antenna phase center in the ECEF frame.","long_name":"y coordinate of the minus_y antenna phase center in the ECEF frame","units":"m","valid_max":10000000.0,"valid_min":-10000000.0}

refs.tvp\/plus_y_antenna_x\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["tvp\/num_tvps"],"comment":"x coordinate of the plus_y antenna phase center in the ECEF frame.","long_name":"x coordinate of the plus_y antenna phase center in the ECEF frame","units":"m","valid_max":10000000.0,"valid_min":-10000000.0}
refs.tvp\/plus_y_antenna_y\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["tvp\/num_tvps"],"comment":"y coordinate of the plus_y antenna phase center in the ECEF frame.","long_name":"y coordinate of the plus_y antenna phase center in the ECEF frame","units":"m","valid_max":10000000.0,"valid_min":-10000000.0}
refs.tvp\/plus_y_antenna_z\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["tvp\/num_tvps"],"comment":"z coordinate of the plus_y antenna phase center in the ECEF frame.","long_name":"z coordinate of the plus_y antenna phase center in the ECEF frame","units":"m","valid_max":10000000.0,"valid_min":-10000000.0}
refs.tvp\/record_counter\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["tvp\/num_tvps"],"comment":"Index of the TVP record used to align data samples across granules.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"record counter","units":"1","valid_max":999999999,"valid_min":1}
refs.tvp\/roll\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["tvp\/num_tvps"],"comment":"KMSF attitude roll angle; positive values move the +y antenna down.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"roll of the spacecraft","units":"degrees","valid_max":180.0,"valid_min":-180.0}
refs.tvp\/time\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["tvp\/num_tvps"],"calendar":"gregorian","comment":"Time of measurement in seconds in the UTC time scale since 1 Jan 2000 00:00:00 UTC. [tai_utc_difference] is the difference between TAI and UTC reference time (seconds) for the first measurement of the data set. If a leap second occurs within the data set, the attribute leap_second is set to the UTC time at which the leap second occurs.","leap_second":"YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss","long_name":"time in UTC","standard_name":"time","tai_utc_difference":"[Value of TAI-UTC at time of first record]","units":"seconds since 2000-01-01 00:00:00.000"}
refs.tvp\/time_tai\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["tvp\/num_tvps"],"calendar":"gregorian","comment":"Time of measurement in seconds in the TAI time scale since 1 Jan 2000 00:00:00 TAI. This time scale contains no leap seconds. The difference (in seconds) with time in UTC is given by the attribute [time:tai_utc_difference].","long_name":"time in TAI","standard_name":"time","units":"seconds since 2000-01-01 00:00:00.000"}
refs.tvp\/velocity_heading\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["tvp\/num_tvps"],"comment":"Angle with respect to true north of the horizontal component of the spacecraft Earth-relative velocity vector. A value of 90 deg indicates that the spacecraft velocity vector pointed due east. Values between 0 and 90 deg indicate that the velocity vector has a northward component, and values between 90 and 180 deg indicate that the velocity vector has a southward component.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"heading of the spacecraft Earth-relative velocity vector","units":"degrees","valid_max":360.0,"valid_min":0.0}
refs.tvp\/vx\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["tvp\/num_tvps"],"comment":"KMSF velocity component in x direction in the ECEF frame.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"x component of the spacecraft velocity in the ECEF frame","units":"m\/s","valid_max":10000.0,"valid_min":-10000.0}

refs.tvp\/x\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["tvp\/num_tvps"],"comment":"x coordinate of the KMSF origin in the ECEF frame.","long_name":"x coordinate of the spacecraft in the ECEF frame","units":"m","valid_max":10000000.0,"valid_min":-10000000.0}

refs.tvp\/yaw\/.zattrs: {"_ARRAY_DIMENSIONS":["tvp\/num_tvps"],"comment":"KMSF attitude yaw angle relative to the nadir track. The yaw angle is a right-handed rotation about the nadir (downward) direction. A yaw value of 0 deg indicates that the KMSF +x axis is aligned with the horizontal component of the Earth-relative velocity vector. A yaw value of 180 deg indicates that the spacecraft is in a yaw-flipped state, with the KMSF -x axis aligned with the horizontal component of the Earth-relative velocity vector.","coordinates":"longitude latitude","long_name":"yaw of the spacecraft","units":"degrees","valid_max":180.0,"valid_min":-180.0}
